templates.name: Huawei VRP by SNMP
templates.description:
Template Net Huawei VRP

MIBs used:
EtherLike-MIB
HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB
HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
SNMPv2-MIB
ENTITY-MIB
IF-MIB

Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

items.name: ICMP ping

triggers.name: Huawei VRP: Unavailable by ICMP ping
triggers.description: Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

triggers.expression: min(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100
triggers.name: Huawei VRP: High ICMP ping loss

dependencies.name: Huawei VRP: Unavailable by ICMP ping

items.name: ICMP response time
items.description: The ICMP ping response time (in seconds).

triggers.name: Huawei VRP: High ICMP ping response time
triggers.description: Average ICMP response time is too high.

dependencies.name: Huawei VRP: High ICMP ping loss
dependencies.expression: min(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and min(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/icmppingloss,5m)<100

dependencies.name: Huawei VRP: Unavailable by ICMP ping

items.name: SNMP traps (fallback)
items.description: The item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items

items.name: System contact details
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

items.name: System description
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
A textual description of the entity. This value should
include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and
networking software.

items.name: Uptime (hardware)
items.description:
MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
The amount of time since this host was last initialized. Note that this is different from sysUpTime in the SNMPv2-MIB [RFC1907] because sysUpTime is the uptime of the network management portion of the system.

items.name: System location
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
Physical location of the node (e.g., `equipment room`, `3rd floor`). If not provided, the value is a zero-length string.

items.name: System name
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

triggers.expression: last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.name))>0
triggers.name: Huawei VRP: System name has changed
triggers.event_name: Huawei VRP: System name has changed (new name: {ITEM.VALUE})
triggers.description: The name of the system has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

items.name: Uptime (network)
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
Time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

items.name: System object ID
items.description:
MIB: SNMPv2-MIB
The vendor's authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determining`what kind of box' is being managed.  For example, if vendor`Flintstones, Inc.' was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its `Fred Router'.

items.name: SNMP agent availability
items.description:
Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list.
Possible values:
0 - not available
1 - available
2 - unknown

triggers.name: Huawei VRP: No SNMP data collection
triggers.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

dependencies.name: Huawei VRP: Unavailable by ICMP ping

trigger_prototypes.name: Huawei VRP: #{#SNMPVALUE}: Fan is in critical state

discovery_rules.name: MPU Discovery
discovery_rules.description: http://support.huawei.com/enterprise/KnowledgebaseReadAction.action?contentId=KB1000090234. Filter limits results to Main Processing Units

item_prototypes.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Temperature
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB
The temperature for the {#SNMPVALUE}.

trigger_prototypes.name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: Temperature is above critical threshold
trigger_prototypes.event_name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"{#ENT_NAME}"}
trigger_prototypes.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototypes.name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: Temperature is above warning threshold
trigger_prototypes.event_name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"{#ENT_NAME}"}
trigger_prototypes.description: This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependencies.name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: Temperature is above critical threshold

trigger_prototypes.name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: Temperature is too low
trigger_prototypes.event_name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: Temperature is too low: <{$TEMP_CRIT_LOW:"{#ENT_NAME}"}

item_prototypes.name: {#ENT_NAME}: CPU utilization
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB
The CPU usage for this entity. Generally, the CPU usage will calculate the overall CPU usage on the entity, and itis not sensible with the number of CPU on the entity.
Reference: http://support.huawei.com/enterprise/KnowledgebaseReadAction.action?contentId=KB1000090234

trigger_prototypes.name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: High CPU utilization
trigger_prototypes.event_name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: High CPU utilization (over {$CPU.UTIL.CRIT}% for 5m)
trigger_prototypes.description: The CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.hw.serialnumber[entPhysicalSerialNum.{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototypes.name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: Device has been replaced
trigger_prototypes.event_name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototypes.description: Device serial number has changed. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

trigger_prototypes.expression: last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.sw.os[entPhysicalSoftwareRev.{#SNMPINDEX}],#1)<>last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.sw.os[entPhysicalSoftwareRev.{#SNMPINDEX}],#2) and length(last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.sw.os[entPhysicalSoftwareRev.{#SNMPINDEX}]))>0
trigger_prototypes.name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: Operating system description has changed
trigger_prototypes.description: Operating system description has changed. Possible reasons that system has been updated or replaced. Acknowledge to close the problem manually.

dependencies.name: Huawei VRP: System name has changed
dependencies.expression: last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.name,#1)<>last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.name,#2) and length(last(/Huawei VRP by SNMP/system.name))>0

item_prototypes.name: {#ENT_NAME}: Memory utilization
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: HUAWEI-ENTITY-EXTENT-MIB
The memory usage for the entity. This object indicates what percent of memory are used.
Reference: http://support.huawei.com/enterprise/KnowledgebaseReadAction.action?contentId=KB1000090234

trigger_prototypes.name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: High memory utilization
trigger_prototypes.event_name: Huawei VRP: {#ENT_NAME}: High memory utilization (>{$MEMORY.UTIL.MAX}% for 5m)
trigger_prototypes.description: The system is running out of free memory.

discovery_rules.name: EtherLike-MIB Discovery
discovery_rules.description: Discovering interfaces from IF-MIB and EtherLike-MIB. Interfaces with up(1) Operational Status are discovered.

item_prototypes.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Duplex status
item_prototypes.description:
MIB: EtherLike-MIB
The current mode of operation of the MAC
entity.  'unknown' indicates that the current
duplex mode could not be determined.

Management control of the duplex mode is
accomplished through the MAU MIB.  When
an interface does not support autonegotiation,
or when autonegotiation is not enabled, the
duplex mode is controlled using
ifMauDefaultType.  When autonegotiation is
supported and enabled, duplex mode is controlled
using ifMauAutoNegAdvertisedBits.  In either
case, the currently operating duplex mode is
reflected both in this object and in ifMauType.

Note that this object provides redundant
information with ifMauType.  Normally, redundant
objects are discouraged.  However, in this
instance, it allows a management application to
determine the duplex status of an interface
without having to know every possible value of
ifMauType.  This was felt to be sufficiently
valuable to justify the redundancy.
Reference: [IEEE 802.3 Std.], 30.3.1.1.32,aDuplexStatus.

trigger_prototypes.name: Huawei VRP: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): In half-duplex mode
trigger_prototypes.description: Please check autonegotiation settings and cabling.

macros.description: Warning threshold of ICMP packet loss in %.
Warning threshold of the average ICMP response time in seconds.
Warning threshold of error packet rate. Can be used with interface name as context.
Filter out loopbacks, nulls, docker veth links and docker0 bridge by default
Time interval for the SNMP availability trigger.
